faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restriction. Non-residents require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), obtainable through local authorities or your property lawyer. No visa requirement exists for property purchase. British nationals post-Brexit maintain equal buying rights. Professional legal representation ensures compliance with Spanish conveyancing regulations and protects your investment.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 10-12% of property price, including: 6-8% transfer tax (varies by region), legal fees (€800-€1,500), notary fees (€500-€1,000), and administration costs. Mortgage-related costs add another 1-2% for independent valuations and arrangement fees. Your Spanish lawyer itemizes exact costs during the purchase process, ensuring transparency and budget accuracy.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign investors access Spanish mortgages through major banks and specialist lenders. Typical requirements include 30-40% deposit, stable income documentation, and credit history verification. Interest rates range from 2.5-4% depending on economic conditions. British investors particularly benefit from established lending relationships between Spanish and UK financial institutions. Your property lawyer recommends mortgage advisors experienced with international clients.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers favorable living costs compared to UK and Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for one person range €800-€1,200, including rent, food, utilities, and entertainment. Healthcare costs decrease through Spanish public system access (€400-€600 annually) or private insurance (€50-€150 monthly). Restaurant meals cost €8-€15, groceries 20-30% below UK pricing. Vera specifically costs less than tourist-focused coastal towns while maintaining excellent amenities and services.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: La Costa Blanca bénéficie un climat méditerranéen with over 320 days annual sunshine and mild winters. Summer temperatures reach 28-30°C (June-September), ideal for beach tourism and rental demand peaks. Winter temperatures average 10-15°C with minimal rainfall. Spring and autumn provide pleasant 18-22°C conditions attracting shoulder-season guests. Consistent weather supports year-round outdoor activities and multi-season rental revenue generation.
